selected_quotes: Plant #diversity increases soil #microbial activity and #soil #carbon storage @Nature @SoilLife @SSSA_soils
Plant diversity increases soil microbial activity and #soil #carbon storage in an experimental grassland
Plant diversity increases soil microbial activity soil carbon storage: now online, with my little contribution

citation.abstract: Plant diversity strongly influences ecosystem functions and services, such as soil carbon storage. However, the mechanisms underlying the positive plant diversity effects on soil carbon storage are poorly understood. We explored this relationship using long-term data from a grassland biodiversity experiment (The Jena Experiment) and radiocarbon ((14)C) modelling. Here we show that higher plant diversity increases rhizosphere carbon inputs into the microbial community resulting in both increased microbial activity and carbon storage. Increases in soil carbon were related to the enhanced accumulation of recently fixed carbon in high-diversity plots, while plant diversity had less pronounced effects on the decomposition rate of existing carbon. The present study shows that elevated carbon storage at high plant diversity is a direct function of the soil microbial community, indicating that the increase in carbon storage is mainly limited by the integration of new carbon into soil and less by the decomposition of existing soil carbon.
citation.title: Plant diversity increases soil microbial activity and soil carbon storage.

news.title: Species diversity protects the climate
news.summary: Plants remove carbon dioxide from the air and incorporate it into plant biomass. A portion of this “fixed” carbon can be stored longer term in the soil through root systems and decomposition after plant death. A study of the Max Planck Institute for Biogeo
